headline: Wells Fargo to sell its railcar business for $4.4 billion
summary: The transaction comes as the megabank is determined to simplify its operating model and shed units that have slower growth prospects or aren't core to its business.

raw.headline: Wells Fargo to sell its railcar business for $4.4 billion
raw.summary: The transaction comes as the megabank is determined to simplify its operating model and shed units that have slower growth prospects or aren't core to its business.

headline: GATX, Brookfield Infrastructure to buy Wells Fargo’s rail assets for $4.4bn
summary: The acquired portfolio, primarily freight cars (95%), has a 97% utilisation rate and a diverse mix of car types.

raw.headline: GATX, Brookfield Infrastructure to buy Wells Fargo’s rail assets for $4.4bn

headline: Wells Fargo Shares Gain on Termination of 2015 OCC Agreements
summary: The WFC stock climbs 1.1% on OCC's 2015 consent order termination, pushing it closer to overcoming regulatory challenges.

raw.headline: Wells Fargo Shares Gain on Termination of 2015 OCC Agreements
raw.summary: The WFC stock climbs 1.1% on OCC's 2015 consent order termination, pushing it closer to overcoming regulatory challenges.

headline: Wells Fargo to sell rail leasing business
summary: Wells Fargo is selling its rail leasing equipment business to a joint venture of GATX Corp. and Brookfield Infrastructure. The post Wells Fargo to sell rail leasing business appeared first on FreightWaves.

raw.headline: Wells Fargo to sell rail leasing business
raw.summary: Wells Fargo is selling its rail leasing equipment business to a joint venture of GATX Corp. and Brookfield Infrastructure. The post Wells Fargo to sell rail leasing business appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: Wells Fargo clears penultimate consent order; asset cap remains
summary: The 2015 order brought by the OCC was the 13th closed since 2019 and the seventh this year. CEO Charlie Scharf indicated Wednesday the bank is inching closer to freedom from the $1.95 trillion asset cap.

raw.headline: Wells Fargo clears penultimate consent order; asset cap remains
raw.summary: The 2015 order brought by the OCC was the 13th closed since 2019 and the seventh this year. CEO Charlie Scharf indicated Wednesday the bank is inching closer to freedom from the $1.95 trillion asset cap.

headline: Wells Fargo & Company Announces Full Redemption of the Capital Securities Issued by CoreStates Capital II and CoreStates Capital III
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, May 30, 2025--Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) and Wells Fargo Bank, National Association (the "Bank") today announced that the Bank, as sponsor of the trusts listed below, has submitted redemption notices to the property trustee for the redemption of the capital securities listed below on June 30, 2025 (the "Redemption Date"). headline: Wells Fargo Signs a Deal to Sell its $4.4 Billion Rail Asset Portfolio
summary: The $4.4 billion rail equipment leasing division of Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE:WFC) will be sold to a joint venture between Brookfield Infrastructure and GATX Corporation. The agreement covers the whole rail operating lease portfolio, which consists of about 105,000 railcars, as well as the rail finance leasing portfolio, which consists of 440 locomotives and […]

headline: Wells Fargo Approaches End of Asset Cap as OCC Lifts 2015 Consent Order
summary: A significant 2015 consent order was lifted by the U.S. Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC), which moved Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE:WFC) closer to removing its $1.95 trillion asset cap. Significant regulatory progress has been made under CEO Charles Scharf, as evidenced by the closing of the seventh regulatory enforcement order in […]
